qas.question: Aside from his university work, where did Eisenhower gain useful contacts?
What Continental Oil leader was Eisenhower tied to?
What was the political orientation of Columbia's teachers?
What state was Frank Abrams' oil company located in?
From where did H.J. Porter hale?

context: The contacts gained through university and <a0_0>American Assembly<a0_0/> fund-raising activities would later become important supporters in Eisenhower's bid for the Republican party nomination and the presidency. Meanwhile, Columbia University's <a2_0>liberal<a2_0/> faculty members became disenchanted with the university president's ties to oilmen and businessmen, including <a1_0>Leonard McCollum<a1_0/>, the president of Continental Oil; Frank Abrams, the chairman of Standard Oil of <a3_0>New Jersey<a3_0/>; Bob Kleberg, the president of the King Ranch; H. J. Porter, a <a4_0>Texas<a4_0/> oil executive; Bob Woodruff, the president of the Coca-Cola Corporation; and Clarence Francis, the chairman of General Foods.
